Diagnosis
	1. Gastric adenocarcinoma, diffuse type
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy with peritoneal biopsies
	28 Feb 2024 Total gastrectomy with D2 lymphadenectomy

	Chemotherapy
	Completed 3 cycles FLOT neoadjuvant chemotherapy Jan-Feb 2024

	Clinical studies
	Enrolled in PLATFORM-Gastric trial arm C (pembrolizumab)

	Current disease status
	Post-operative stage ypT2N2M0

	Current issues
	Mild post-gastrectomy syndrome

	Summary of consultation
	This 58-year-old gentleman has completed neoadjuvant FLOT chemotherapy followed by total gastrectomy for locally advanced gastric cancer. Post-operative histology confirms ypT2N2M0 disease with 5/15 positive lymph nodes. Molecular profiling demonstrates MSI-high status with PDL1 CPS 15, making him eligible for the immunotherapy arm of PLATFORM-Gastric trial.

He has recovered well from surgery with only mild early satiety and occasional dumping symptoms, well-managed with dietary modification. His weight has stabilized at 72kg (pre-treatment weight 78kg). Performance status is 1.

We have completed trial screening investigations including CT chest/abdomen/pelvis showing no evidence of metastatic disease, normal cardiac echo, and satisfactory blood parameters. He meets all eligibility criteria for trial arm C.

I have discussed the trial protocol in detail, including the requirement for pembrolizumab every 3 weeks for one year, with 3-monthly CT scans and quality of life assessments. We reviewed potential immune-related adverse events and monitoring requirements. He has signed trial consent forms after a 24-hour cooling-off period.

	Further investigations
	Baseline CT chest/abdomen/pelvis completed 20 March 2024
	Baseline thyroid function and cortisol completed

	Medication prescribed
	Pembrolizumab 200mg IV every 3 weeks as per trial protocol

	Follow up
	First trial treatment 28 March 2024
Weekly review for first 6 weeks
Then 3-weekly reviews with treatment

	Required GP actions
	Alert team if any new symptoms develop, particularly autoimmune phenomena
Monitor thyroid function monthly as per protocol
